Articles.Content:
**Airbus A319** 

**By: ghostbuzzer7**

![KlzBZCe.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KlzBZCe.jpg)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/piy4w)

**Details**

- **Mass: 70.4 Tons**
- **Seats: 69 Seats**
- **Maximum Speed: 212 Meters per second.**
- **Dimensions: Height: 9.6 Meters, Width: 24.1 meters, Length: 25.8 meters**
- **Part Count: 109**
- **How much dead mass can it lift: 76 tons maximum!! \*Thats 1.08 x its own weight"**

**Flight Instructions**

**1. Throttle up Engines and start engines**

**2. Stay on runway until a minimum of 80 meters per second is achieved. Begin pitching up at 10 degrees**

**3. Retract landing gears at an altitude 150 meters.**

**4. Fly the airbus with its cargo anywhere you want.**

**Landing Instructions:**

**1. Align yourself with the runway.**

**2. Throttle down to half (Should bring you to about 100 meters per second more or less)**

**3. Upon 100 meters of the runway or just patch of land, kill the throttle (Stalling speed for this Airbus is around 60 meters per second)**

**4. Pitch up until your reach your angle of incidence**

**5. Slowly touchdown onto the runway and rejoice that you didn't kill 69 kerbals.**

**Download the craft here:** **** [https://www.dropbox.com/s/e78iacxpxv6owv5/AirBus%20A319.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/e78iacxpxv6owv5/AirBus%20A319.craft?dl=0)

**Happy Flying!!** ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-26T22:34:38Z" title="04/26/2015 10:34  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 26, 2015</time> by ghostbuzzer7**

Nice plane! But I'm afraid it doesn't look very much like an Airbus A319.

![b857ee505d.jpg](http://www.airbus.com/typo3temp/pics/b857ee505d.jpg)

It still looks like it would make a nice SSTO with some modifications.
I have a hard time believing that that thing is stuck at 212 m/s... I suspect it could probably do mach 3 at high altitude, if not faster.

> 
> Nice plane! But I'm afraid it doesn't look very much like an Airbus A319.
> [http://www.airbus.com/typo3temp/pics/b857ee505d.jpg](http://www.airbus.com/typo3temp/pics/b857ee505d.jpg)
> 
> It still looks like it would make a nice SSTO with some modifications.

First of all, great looking jet. However, calling it a Jumbo jet is not the greatest definition. That is more of a mid-sized airliner...a turbojet airliner! Just my own nit-picking.
